descript.abstract: Urban areas in the context of this dataset includes the Twin Cities Metro Area, as well as outstate metro areas and rural downtowns, for all municipalities with more than 100 residents.
descript.purpose: This is a cartographic layer designed to show the full and general extent of urban areas, rather than the extent of municipal boundaries. It can be useful as a simplified layer for cartography and isolating areas of higher population and interest.

idinfo.useconst: By acceptance of this data, the user agrees to include a copy of this metadata record, including the liability disclaimer, whenever the user transmits or provides the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user.

procstep.procdesc: The Twin Cities Metro Area, several Outstate Metro areas, and Rural Downtowns in five regions (Northeast, Northwest, Central, Southwest, and Southeast) were merged in December 2008 to simplify the data and apply "Names" to the urban areas.

distinfo.distliab: This data was developed by the Minnesota Department of Agriculture (MDA) for its own internal business purposes. MDA DOES NOT REPRESENT OR WARRANT THAT THE DATA OR DOCUMENTATION ARE ERROR-FREE, COMPLETE, CURRENT, OR ACCURATE. The user accepts the data 'as is', and is responsible for any consequences resulting from its use. The user should consult the data documentation for this particular data to determine its limitations and the precision with which it may depict distance, direction, location, or other geographic features. By accepting this data, the user agrees not to transmit this data or provide access to it or any part of it to another party unless the user shall include with the data a copy of this disclaimer.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: a descriptive name used to describe aggregates of urgan areas

edom.edomvd: Duluth and immediately surrounding urban areas
Mankato and North Mankato urban areas
St. Cloud and immediately surrounding urban areas
all urban areas in the 7 metro counties described in Type
Contained by the 7 county metro region of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott, and Washington counties.
Metro areas with populations greater than 30,000 people and are not in the Twin Cities 7 county metro area
Concentrated development appearing to be a business district or mid to high density housing outside the 7 county metro area.
